Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of upper part of satyr with faded hair band, to right with right hand raised, left hand lowered, possibly resting on left leg (satyr might be seated, or standing with left leg resting on elevated ground); at right, part of possible large drinking horn decorated with narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Dionysos may well have been pictured to the right.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E153.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0359) (Phase 1)
